result.execSummary:
The defendant Dante T Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,886.00 payable to Kirk C., $178.00 payable to Kim P., and $200.00 payable to Yer. L. JOINT AND SEVERAL with other co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers., Lashawn Brooks., Isiah T. Thomas., and Anthony Griffis. Cash bail applied.

BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample; pay the related surcharge. Pay court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT. Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of ES; non-payment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
CONCURRENT with juvenile time, with credit for 279 days time served

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of extended supervision.
- Pay all supervision fees.
- Obtain/maintain employment unless in school. If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- No Contact with co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers, Lashawn Brooks, Isiah Thomas, Anthony Griffis; No Contact with victims.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- No alcohol or controlled substances.
- No operation of motor vehicle without a license.
- Sentencing memorandum from Paasch Anderson to be attached to the JOC and forwarded to prison system.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dante T Scott in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Dante T Scott in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 14 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 YEARS, concurrent with juvenile time, with credit for 279 days time served. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $2,886.00 payable to Kirk C., $178.00 payable to Kim P., and $200 payable to Yer L. joint and several with other co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers., Lashawn Brooks., Isiah T Thomas., Anthony Griffis. 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable out of cash bail on deposit.  Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected payable out of cash bail on deposit.  Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers, Lashawn Brooks, Isiah Thomas, Anthony Griffis; no contact with victims 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances 
-No operation of motor vehicle without a license
-Sentencing memorandum from Paasch Anderson to be attached to the Judgment of Conviction and forwarded to prison system

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 1,  with credit for 279 days time served. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $2,886.00 payable to Kirk C., $178.00 payable to Kim P., and $200 payable to Yer L. joint and several with other co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers., Lashawn Brooks., Isiah T Thomas., Anthony Griffis.     
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments payable out of cash bail on deposit.  Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected payable out of cash bail on deposit.  Any remaining balance to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with co-actors Rocarldo Chalmers, Lashawn Brooks, Isiah Thomas, Anthony Griffis; no contact with victims 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances 
-No operation of motor vehicle without a license
-Sentencing memorandum from Paasch Anderson to be attached to the Judgment of Conviction and forwarded to prison system
 
 Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Dante T Scott not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court not in session.  Parties request this matter be adjourned rather than attempt to find a spin court to conduct this sentencing as this Court is very familiar with this case.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed.

Defendant Dante T Scott in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Dante T Scott in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts:  1 & 2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
As to Counts:  3 & 4:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed and read in the counts.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Defendant is REMANDED.  State filed:  Risk Assessment
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

For reasons stated on the record, the Court raises cash bail to $10,000 ($5,000 previously posted, $5,000 remains due).  Court orders Justice Point supervision to include ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.

Attorney Russell Dennis Bohach in court, defendant Dante T Scott not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 04-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante T Scott in court with attorney Russell Dennis Bohach.  Defendant Dante T Scott in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kirk C.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
